intro: Dodecatheon jeffreyanum, commonly known as Jeffrey's glory-of-the-snow, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Dodecatheon jeffreyanum blooms in early spring, adding a striking visual element to its natural habitat.
